author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
<!-- Anything that looks like this is a comment and can't be seen after the Pull Request is created. -->

# PR Summary

<!-- Summarize your PR between here and the checklist. -->

## PR Context

<!-- Provide a little reasoning as to why this Pull Request helps and why you have opened it. -->

## PR Checklist

- [ ] [PR has a meaningful title](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
    - Use the present tense and imperative mood when describing your changes
- [ ] [Summarized changes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [ ] [Change is not breaking](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#making-breaking-changes)
- [ ] [Make sure all `.h`, `.cpp`, `.cs`, `.ps1` and `.psm1` files have the correct copyright header](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [ ] This PR is ready to merge and is not [Work in Progress](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---work-in-progress).
    - If the PR is work in progress, please add the prefix `WIP:` or `[ WIP ]` to the beginning of the title (the `WIP` bot will keep its status check at `Pending` while the prefix is present) and remove the prefix when the PR is ready.
- **User-facing changes**
    - [ ] Not Applicable
    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Documentation needed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
        - [ ] Issue filed: <!-- Number/link of that issue here -->
- **Testing - New and feature**
    - [ ] N/A or can only be tested interactively
    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Make sure you've added a new test if existing tests do not effectively test the code changed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#before-submitting)

comments.author: PoshChan
comments.body:
@SteveL-MSFT, your last commit had 2 failures in `PowerShell-CI-macos`
Send-MailMessage.Error occurred in Describe block
```powershell
Cannot bind argument to parameter 'Path' because it is null.
At /Users/vsts/agent/2.150.3/work/1/s/test/powershell/Modules/Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility/Send-MailMessage.Tests.ps1:11 char:30
```
Convert-Path tests.Convert-Path supports pipelined input by property name
```powershell
Expected exactly /private/tmp/1eb7c052-e3dc-4190-87fc-517831f76f7d, but got '/private/tmp/1eb7c052-e3dc-4190-87fc-517831f76f7d'.
at <ScriptBlock>, /Users/vsts/agent/2.150.3/work/1/s/test/powershell/Modules/Microsoft.PowerShell.Management/Convert-Path.Tests.ps1: line 17
17:         Get-Item -Path $TestDrive | Convert-Path | Should -BeExactly $TestDrive
```

comments.author: PoshChan
comments.body:
@SteveL-MSFT, your last commit had 4 failures in `PowerShell-CI-windows`
PowerShellGet - Module tests (Admin).Error occurred in Describe block
```powershell
Exception calling "ShouldContinue" with "2" argument(s): "Object reference not set to an instance of an object."
At D:\a\1\s\src\powershell-win-core\bin\release\netcoreapp3.0\win7-x64\publish\Modules\PowerShellGet\PSModule.psm1:11044 char:9
```
PowerShellGet - Script tests (Admin).Error occurred in Describe block
```powershell
Exception calling "ShouldContinue" with "2" argument(s): "Object reference not set to an instance of an object."
At D:\a\1\s\src\powershell-win-core\bin\release\netcoreapp3.0\win7-x64\publish\Modules\PowerShellGet\PSModule.psm1:11044 char:9
```
Convert-Path tests.Convert-Path supports pipelined input by property name
```powershell
Expected exactly C:\Users\VssAdministrator\AppData\Local\Temp\5c5ea23b-c5eb-4961-80ab-215d46ac7de3, but got 'C:\Users\VssAdministrator\AppData\Local\Temp\5c5ea23b-c5eb-4961-80ab-215d46ac7de3'.
at <ScriptBlock>, D:\a\1\s\test\powershell\Modules\Microsoft.PowerShell.Management\Convert-Path.Tests.ps1: line 17
17:         Get-Item -Path $TestDrive | Convert-Path | Should -BeExactly $TestDrive
```
Send-MailMessage.Error occurred in Describe block
```powershell
Cannot bind argument to parameter 'Path' because it is null.
At D:\a\1\s\test\powershell\Modules\Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility\Send-MailMessage.Tests.ps1:11 char:30
```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: The current failures are due to PackageManagement issue that's been fixed, but waiting on a new version to be published to PSGallery

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
It seems PackageManagement is last issue, yes?
Make sense to have in future a branch to run tests everyday for latest .Net Core builds? In the case we will see breaking change earlier.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT

comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT, this is the reminder you requested 1 minute ago

title: Update to Pester 4.8.0, revert workaround for long paths
